page.title: 07AMERSHAM GENERAL HOSPITAL
page.content: The old buildings of the hospital were originally a work house from 1840 to 1930.There are 250 beds:89 for old people:21 for children,8 for maternity and the rest for surgical and medical patients.The Casualty unit had to be transferred to Wycombe Hospital because of difficulties in staffing.We visited the switchboard and recorded a message for Mrs Haylett (who took us around.)Then we watched blood being crossmatched into different blood groups in the path:lab.We saw 3 babies born that day in maternity ;they usually stay in 3 days.They had lots of toys and dressing up clothes in the children's ward,and their parents can stay with them.Then we saw the elderly patients, they have steps and frames to practice walking again after an operation.
